messages: a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:33): hmm.... anyone ever messed with these ralink radios under linux?
ae14c9e24a49e9d64ac13612c9c7c0e0 (02:34): J4k3: I am in the process of building a devicescape kernel (I have an ralink 2500 I want to try with hostapd) or are you talking about the mimo ones ?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:35): I'm wondering if the AP mode works... and what kind of input voltage range you can 'get away' with
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:35): it appears to be a switching psu
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:35): I can't get the actual switcher ICs to resolve to anything useful

ae14c9e24a49e9d64ac13612c9c7c0e0 (02:37): I think it needs svn hostapd (to even be possible) and either the cvs version of rt2xx (2.6.17 or later) or the wireless-git kernel (which I am building at the moment)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:39): I may just stick to STA mode on them
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:39): I'm going to attempt to use them over cat5 with a power hack
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:40): I've read the data side is good for about 80 ft
ae14c9e24a49e9d64ac13612c9c7c0e0 (02:41): J4k3: The drivers provided by ralink are very very unreliable (loads worse than madwifi)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:42): eww... I've noticed their windows stuff worked pretty good.... damn :|
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:47): oh well, I'll stick to using them for close-in mesh-area clients.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (02:47): the ones I don't need to be repeater sites

ae14c9e24a49e9d64ac13612c9c7c0e0 (02:50): J4k3: http://rt2x00.serialmonkey.com/wiki/index.php/Main_Page (could try the legacy ones from there - they are just a fixed version of the gpl ones ralink provided (and are less experimental)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (03:04): any idea what the default max ack time is with the ralink radios in windows? ;)
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (03:05): J4k3: yes i do of course
